messages.message: Small point of feedback - I'm testing out how to assign different values using derived fields (relevant thread here (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05BJCNKZAM/p1729871910878859)) and noticed that you can't start a new line sometimes (other times it works). I typically use `Shift+Enter` to start new lines but in Derived Field it selects a field to reference. For formatting longer prompts, I think being able to start new lines is important for readability. Maybe being able to mention field names using `@` like some other people suggested before would help?
CC: @Serena to follow up on this feedback
this feedback is already captured here https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-2927

however, please note that long prompts often do not work well for derived field prompts

in other words, i don’t recommend adding newlines in your derived field prompt :sweat_smile:
@Serena Okay :sweat_smile: I really just want to experiment with simple if/then or case/when statements based on other field values and it seems to be working okay for now? But understood!
ah based on the previous thread (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05BJCNKZAM/p1729871910878859), i thought you didn’t get good results for that logic? did something change?
Comparing two different derived fields to each other didn't work but comparing one derived field to a hardcoded string seems to work better
